data.title: Lunch buffet
data.text: Great food experience at an affordable price.  May take a couple of visits before you truly begin to appreciate the meal.

data.title: Really Different and Worth the Stop
data.text: This is a really cool microbrewery and restaurant that has a distinctive Nepal feel. The micro brews are different, like a Chai Stout and Himalayan IPA and many others. The food is varied with a lot of curries and vegetarian entrees. All very affordable, and tucked away in old town Arvada, only about 5 minutes from Costco. It will take you into another world.

data.title: The friendliest people in Arvada come to Yak and Yeti for great food and drinks
data.text: The old house is charming and has a sense of history about it. The food is very well prepared and served with a smile. The beer selection and mixed drinks make the visit even better.

data.title: Gorgeous Victorian home converted into a restaurant/brewery.
data.text: Gorgeous Victorian home converted into a restaurant/brewery. Service is excellent. Buffet is great for discovering what your favorite Indian foods might be.

data.title: GREAT Indian Food
data.text: Got carryout from here and every dish we selected was just VERY VERY good.  Definitely give it a thumbs up!  And got an excellent chai while I was waiting.

data.title: Beer after work.
data.text: We,l the name of this brewery lured us in and glad it did.  Beers were delicious. I had a  Lemon blonde and the husband had a 152 IPA limited release.  We didn't eat, but the menu looked interested with an indian flair.  There are two locations, we want to check out both.  Love the taps for the draft beer...see photo.

data.title: Amazing, consistent food
data.text: You will not leave hungry.  We ate lunch and enjoyed a fully stocked buffet, complete with vegetarian, gluten free, and meat dishes.  Dessert was delicious.  Very clean with amazing service.

data.title: The name is the best part
data.text: This is a fun restaurant. Great name, and blending Indian and brew pub is super cool. The menu is light on actual Nepalese food, and if you're looking for super high quality Indian, you can probably do better. The beer selection (flights) are great, and you won't regret a visit.

data.title: Brew pub - great beer and food
data.text:
Read about this on a list of Denver area pubs to try.  Disappointed they didn't have the Yakity-Yak (Don't talk Bock) beer (wanted to try that just for the name alone!) but had a flight.  

Went after touring Red Rocks, was going to stop in just for a beer on the way back to Denver, but decided to have the lunch buffet.  Great Indian/Tibetan food.   Wanted to have seconds but was too full :)  Beer selection pretty good.   Service just average.

data.title: Can't say a single negative thing.
data.text:
I've had a lot of good experiences with restaurants since coming to the denver/boulder area. Yak and Yeti was another one.

This place was phenomonal. I plan on going back when I get enjoy the buffet, but we went for dinner when my girlfriends family came into town.

Food was portioned appropriately for the price and was spectacular. There are a ton of fantastic South Asian restaurants in the area, and I don't think Yak and yeti did anything particular to stand out, but we're comparing top quality with top quality -- Standing out is going to be some sort of miracle.

We got jalapeño cheese naan which seemed to be a rather unique addition, some garlic naan, chicken curry, lentils and saag, and a few other awesome dishes. As normal per Indian/Tibetan/Nepalese, tons of vegetarian choices. All of it was delicious.

Beers available were excellent and also reasonably priced, and our service was timely with a great attitude.

Definitely worth a visit.

data.title: It's probably great if you like that kind of food.
data.text: We went with friends, had a little of everything to get a good taste for the place, everything was fine, service was amazing,  we just realized we didn't like that kind of food. But it's probably great if you like Indian food. It was hot and fresh just not our thing. But I would for sure go if you like that kind of food. We love the building itself always used to go there when it was the old Cheshire Cat restaurant. I just wish it had a different kind of menu.

data.title: New location, same great food
data.text: I had only been to the Westminster location, but this one is also great. Good beer and great food! Perfect way to wrap up a fun weekend in the mountains.

data.title: Loved it!
data.text: Great atmosphere, service and food! This place was overall just great when I was there. Can't wait to go again.

data.title: Best Indian restaurant on the West Side!
data.text:
I love Yak and Yeti. The food is delicious, and the ambiance even better with traditional Indian, Nepalese and Tibetan art work, furniture and more. There are two lovely private dining areas upstairs, and a world class Friday evening buffet. Excellent microbrewery, as well. 

Plan ahead - it's crowded on weekends.

data.title: A great restaurant for any occasion!
data.text:
I visit this spot with a group of girlfriends every 4-6 weeks and we love it so much every time that we do not even consider looking elsewhere for our ladies dinners! 

Typically most of us do the dinner buffet because it is so reasonably priced and has tons of options (including for vegetarians!) and everything is so delicious. However, the regular entrees are always a big hit too. 

I always enjoy a moscow mule with their home brewed ginger beer in it. I understand that their beers are excellent as well although they are not my top choice.

data.title: Love it! Carnivors and vegetarians both.
data.text: I have been here two times for the buffet both times on a Friday night. You get to try a variety of dishes, vegetarians can delight in the fact that everything is clearly placed so you know which is which. The tandoori chicken is great. My beer drinking friends give the craft beers a the craft beers a thumbs up too! The naan bread is amazing!

data.title: Service was so slow we had to leave
data.text:
The exterior looked great.  We waited almost 15 minutes server...within that time we decided to leave to find somewhere we could get a meal.  
The menu was interesting, lots of curry dishes and what appeared to be some great vegetarian dishes.  From what I can tell there was also a buffet.
My advice... If you're hungry and in a hurry don't go.  If you value great service don't go.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Great Indian/Nepali food and good beer! Super hospitable staff.  We had the chicken biryani and some chicken dumplings along with samosas. Just amazing.

data.title: Awesome Indian food and a great brew pub
data.text: Come visit Yak and Yeti, located at the edge of Olde Towne Arvada, and you will find amazing Indian food, served piping hot, and with an authentic micro brewery, and an English pub atmosphere.  The restaurant also has a full bar. My wife and I visited Yak & Yeti this past Monday night, and every table was full.  The food choices are great.  Try the Tandoori chicken.

data.title: Service a little slow, but this place is great!
data.text:
In a group of four we walked in here at 6:15 on a Friday night and were seated right away. We were given water right upon sitting, however it was 15 minutes before a waiter came by to ask for our orders. 

While the wait was long, the atmosphere was perfect for chatting. We could easily hear one another without feeling overheard. We all decided to have the Buffett and were happy with our decisions. There were approximately a dozen different hot dishes and several dessert items as well. There were enough customers for the Buffett to be fresh and constantly refilled, it was great. We tasted everything we wanted, had some great conversation and though the waiter service, including drink refills, were slow, we had a fantastic time.
